poem:
Title: The Prophet's Voice in a Stilled World

Dark heralds sing again,
Polish power stirs cold discontent.
Urging rearmament's bitter refrain,
In Europe's fretful lament.
The east, sinister shadow cast,
Calls forth old, spectred fear.
Iron dreams of imperial past,
Make stark our present year.
To foster unity, a vote;
To combat, strength and scheme. 
A mechanised, metallic coat,
In this sombre dream.
Yet, in quiet Ukrainian land,
War-weary hearts, return's demand.
